sen.j: 杉原鐡城（すぎはら てつじょう、1870年? - ?）は、明治時代に広島県一帯で「未来の内閣総理大臣」として知られた人物。
sen.e: Tetsujo SUGIHARA (1870? to ?) was known as "the future prime minister" in Hiroshima Prefecture in the Meiji period.

sen.j: 彼は年中様々な人を訪れて自身が未来の総理大臣になることを誓い、人々に本名ではなく「大臣」と呼ばれ笑って迎えられた。
sen.e: He visited many people and swore them that he would be a prime minister in the future, and people laughed and welcomed him by calling him 'a minister" instead of his real name.

sen.j: 杉原は詩作を好み、内閣総理大臣自身となる自分の抱負を詩にしていた。
sen.e: Sugihara liked to write poetry, and he wrote about his ambition to be the prime minister.

sen.j: その一年分の詩を印刷して有志に配布し、年会費1円以内を「租税」と称して徴収することを商売としていた。
sen.e: He printed out his poems of one year and distributed them to his supporters, which he made money from by collecting the annual membership fee of less than 1 yen from them as 'tax'.

sen.j: 日本統治時代の朝鮮からの帰りに厳島の弥山 (広島県)に登山した伊藤は、山上で杉原の抱負を述べた詩集『登閣詩稿』を手渡されたが返す言葉も無かった。
sen.e: When Ito climbed Mt. Misen (Hiroshima Prefecture) of Ituskushima on the way back from Korea during the period of Japan's rule, Sugihara gave him a collection of his poems "Toukaku Shiko" and Ito had no reply.
